Authors: Ya-Ya Chen, Asha Janadaree Dissanayake, Jian-Kui Liu
Title:
Botryosphaeria species from nature reserves in Guizhou
province of China including B. guttulata sp. nov
Keywords:
1 new taxon, Botryosphaeriaceae, phylogeny, taxonomy,
wood-inhabiting fungi
Abstract:
Members of the genus Botryosphaeria encompass important
plant pathogens, saprobes, and endophytes on a wide range of woody hosts
with a worldwide distribution. Botryosphaeria species are difficult to
differentiate since the overlap of morphological characteristics. In
this study, we obtained 28 Botryosphaeria isolates from decaying woody
hosts in six nature reserves (Fanjing mountain, Guiyang Huaxi Wetland
Park, Guiyang Xiaochehe Wetland Park, Maolan Natural Reserve, Suiyang
broad water nature reserve and Xingii Wanfenglin) in Guizhou province of
China. Based on the evidences of morphological comparison and molecular
analysis of combined ITS and tef1-Î± DNA sequence data, four known
species (Botryosphaeria dothidea, B. minutispermatia, B. sinensia, B.
wangensis) are identified and one novel species B. guttulata is
introduced. Botryosphaeria sinensia (32 % of the isolates obtained from
various hosts in nature reserves) is the dominant species, followed by
B. dothidea (28 % of the isolates), B. guttulata (28 % of the isolates),
B. minutispermatia (7 % of the isolates) and B. wangensis (4 % of the
isolates). These results represent the first study of Botryosphaeria
species associated with woody hosts from nature reserves in Guizhou
province of China. Our findings indicate that there is a potential of
Botryosphaeria species remain to be discovered in this unique landform
(Karst formations) from Guizhou of China.
